page.title: 03 HOW HATTERSLEY DEVELOPED
page.content:
Manchester had to rehouse the people from the densely-built slum area of East Gorton. Money was available but no land. The city was forced to build an overspill elsewhere. It chose Hyde.
There was considerable resistance to this idea. In September 1956 a petition against the overspill was signed by many in the market place at Hyde.
Despite the protests the Estate at Hattersley was built and the first residents arrived in May 1963. They were welcomed by the Mayor. The Estate was not completed until 1973 when Queen's Walk where the shops are, was built.
